plugins.name: WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker (SC 1.4.4) for Design Systems
plugins.description:
The WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker plugin designed to help you ensure that your design system components comply with SC 1.4.4: Resize Text (Level AA). This plugin helps verify that all text elements within your Figma designs behave appropriately when resized to 200% of their original size.


Key features:

  1. 200% text resize: duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.
  2. All component checking: works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line height adjustments: allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.
plugins.tagline: Check the behavior of your design system components according to the 200% text resize (WCAG 2.2)

124999.name: WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker (SC 1.4.4) for Design Systems
124999.description:

Key features:

  1. 200% text resize: duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.
  2. All component checking: works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line height adjustments: allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.
124999.tagline: Check the behavior of your design system components according to the 200% text resize (WCAG 2.2)

plugins.name: Hunch - Figma export for Hunch Creative Studio
plugins.description:
It is used to export Figma frames to Hunch Studio templates. By export you can expect .zip file with JSON data & all images used in the design.


It is primarily used by Hunch clients whose designers are working in Figma so they do not need to recreate a design in Hunch Studio while trying to scale the production and variants.

For more info visit:

www.hunchads.com
plugins.tagline: Import your Figma creatives into Hunch Creative Studio

For more info visit:

www.hunchads.com

plugins.name: Icon Stitch
plugins.description:
Icon Stitch is a plugin for exporting icon sets as SVG sprites. It optimizes your icons for the web and exports them as a single file. Icon Stitch streamlines workflow by generating code for easy integration into your projects and is a time-saver tool for developers and designers who need to work with icons.


Key features:


- Create with a single click

- Optimize for performance and web

- Streamline your workflow with generated code

- Validate potential issues and resolve with ease

- Import SVG sprites to visualize file contents


The plugin contains paid features:


The free version allows you to create and export SVG sprites with up to 20 icons.

Consider upgrading to support development and lift the limit.


For technical support, feature requests, and general feedback, please create a new issue on the GitHub repository.


---


Icons from Icons Basic Set.

accepted.name: Raimonds Sarkanbardis
accepted.description: Working hard to make the world better with software.

plugins.tagline: Create and export optimized SVG icon sprites.

plugins.name: Select and Inspect
plugins.description:
Why?


If you ever implemented a Figma plugin, you know how slow the process of inspecting specific properties (among the hundreds available) and values in a Figma file is.


This plugin aims to solve this problem by making logging as easy as possible!


Features

  1. Select one or more Figma elements to get them logged in the Console
  2. Add expressions to be evaluated on the selected Figma elements (name,id,reactions[0].actions results in each expression to be evaluated and logged in the Console)
  3. Stringy and format the result for better readability
  4. Preferences are stored locally


FAQ

Why not using the existing "Inspector" plugin?

Because the properties must be added to the UI by the plugin's author, limiting the plugin's scalability (as you can see in the reviews).
plugins.tagline: Select an item and get it logged in Console

84365.name: Select and Inspect
84365.description:

84365.release_notes: Invoke evaluated expressions if they are functions and await the returned promises if needed
84365.tagline: Select an item and get it logged in Console

plugins.name: Background Color Generator
plugins.description:
Summary:

This plugin is ideal for B2B products where you want to integrate a client’s branding color into background designs while maintaining accessibility and strong visual contrast.


How to use:

Pick a color using the hue slider or a HEX code. Select the layer you want to apply the color to, then simply click the button to apply it. The plugin generates light and dark variations with the same hue.


Accessibility Compliance:

This plugin follows the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for color contrast:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.
  3. For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.
  4. The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.


(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
plugins.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

131068.name: Background Color Generator
131068.description:

Accessibility Compliance:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.

131068.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

plugins.name: Annotations buster™
plugins.description:
Imagine you are going to show your design to stakeholders, but it's full of annotations that you don't want them to see.


You can either teach each stakeholder to hide annotations via shortcut, or you need to copy the mocks to a new page/file, and then manually remove dozens/hundreds of annotations...


No longer!


With the Annotations buster™ plugin you can clean up your stakeholder review mockups in one go.


Video demo -> https://youtu.be/tjQdLxtF01o


If you like this plugin, consider sharing on the socials or buying me an oat-milk latte → https://www.buymeacoffee.com/menosketiago

accepted.name: Tiago Almeida
accepted.description: Design Systems at Volvo Cars — Ex-Klarna/Mentimeter — DesignOps and Leadership

plugins.tagline: Delete all annotation on the current page

plugins.name: The Settler — localizer for external (or missing) alias variables
plugins.description:
(Русский внизу 👇)

en:

This plugin localises all alias variables that refer to missing base variables (those located in external files or simply deleted)

🎦 Video demonstration: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk


Why is this a problem?! Figma doesn't care about these links, it doesn't transfer them to the new file, but leaves the links to the companion variables (base/master variables) in the old file. And this isn't what you expect when you copy variables :)


In simple words, what the plugin does:

  1. It looks for alias variables that have a reference to base variables that didn't make it to this file (either left in another file or simply missing)
  2. Creates copies of such variables in this file
  3. Rebinds the alias variable, changing the reference from the external master variable (base variable) to the newly created local one


Works for variables of all types:

  1. color,
  2. text,
  3. boolean,
  4. numeric

It should work with multiple mods, but I haven't tested this part.


ru:

Плагин поможет, когда вы взяли и "тупа" скопировали переменные из другого файла, а там были алиасы (переменные ссылались на другие переменные).

🎦 Видео-демонстрация: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk

Но вот незадача! Figma не заботиться об этих связях, она не переносит их в новый файл, а оставляет ссылки на переменные-спутники (базовые/мастер-переменные) в старом файле. А это вообще не то, чего ждёшь, когда копируешь переменные :)


Простыми словами, что делает плагин:

  1. Ищет переменные-алиасы, которые ссылаются на базовые переменные, не дошедшие до этого файла (либо оставшиеся в другом файле, либо пропавшие без вести)
  2. Создает копии таких переменных в этом файле
  3. Перевязывает алиас-переменную, меняя ссылку с внешней мастер-переменной (базовой переменной) на локальную


Работает для переменных всех типов:

  1. цветовые,
  2. текстовые,
  3. булевы,
  4. числовые


По идее, должно работает и с множественными модами, но я не тестил этот момент

accepted.name: Studio The
accepted.description:
The UX/UI designer,
The Motion designer

plugins.tagline: Settle down your external alias variables (Localise missing or external aliases of your variables)

  7. Modals

plugins.name: iconSync
plugins.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assets—especially icons—can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

🎯 One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


🧠 Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


🔁 Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

⚙️ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


⚠️ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents → `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata → `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests → `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


You’ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner – your GitHub username or organization name

API Key – your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name – usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name – a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name – the target GitHub repository

Store Path – the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, you’re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you won’t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
plugins.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

131205.name: iconSync

plugins.name: Dummy Details Filler
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you populate your designs with dummy data. Unlike other data generators, this plugin gives you precise control over your generated content through customizable options for each data type. This is perfect for mockups, prototypes, and design presentations.


Data Types:

  1. Generate various types of realistic data:
  2. Full Names (International names from different cultures)
  3. Usernames (Customizable patterns)
  4. Email Addresses (Custom domains and formats)
  5. Phone Numbers (US, UK, France, Germany, Sri Lanka formats)
  6. Physical Addresses
  7. Company Names
  8. Job Titles
  9. Dates (Short, Long, ISO, European formats)
  10. Numbers (Custom ranges)
  11. Lorem Ipsum (Custom length)
  12. Passwords (Adjustable length and complexity)
  13. File Names (Various types and extensions)
  14. Domain Names
  15. IP Addresses
  16. Color Codes (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  17. Zip/Postal Codes (US, UK, Canada formats)
  18. Cities (Global selection)
  19. Countries
  20. UUID
  21. Prices (Multiple currencies and formats)
  22. Account Numbers
  23. Currency Symbols & Codes
  24. URL-friendly Slugs


Each data type comes with its own set of customization options, allowing you to generate exactly the kind of data you need for your designs. Whether you're creating a simple contact list or a complex dashboard, Dummy Details Filler helps you create more realistic and meaningful mockups quickly and efficiently.


Made with ❤️ by Yasir Ahamad
plugins.tagline: Fill your designs with dummy data instantly with more control!

With Mirror Signage's Figma plugin, updating your connected screens content is a breeze! Just choose your design in Figma, pick your playlist, hit 'Export,' and voilà – your screens will automatically update with the new design.


Need to update menus or any other info? Simply export the design you’ve already worked on, and it’ll refresh the content on your screen in no time.


Take full advantage of Figma's power and its awesome plugins to create anything you need – from menus and info screens to dashboards.


Start a free trial today – no credit card required!

plugins.name: Populate JSON data
plugins.description:
✨ JSON-to-Design Plugin

🚀 Supercharge Your Design Workflow


Bring your templates to life with data-driven automation! The JSON-to-Design Plugin allows you to effortlessly populate and duplicate designs using simple JSON files.


Key Features


✅ Upload JSON Files

Supports two formats:


  1. Array format: Automatically duplicates selected designs for each object in the array while replacing placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}.


{
"array": [
{ "name": "John", "surname": "Doe" },
{ "name": "Emma", "surname": "Walker" },
{ "name": "Liam", "surname": "Harris" }
]
}


  1. Object format: Updates a single design with JSON values without duplication.


{
"name": "John",
"surname": "Doe"
}


✅ Dynamic Placeholder Replacement

Replace {{name}}, {{surname}}, or other placeholders in text elements with real data—seamlessly integrate information into your designs.


✅ Save Time and Effort

Eliminate repetitive manual tasks by automating data entry and duplication. Perfect for projects requiring consistent layouts with unique data sets.


How to Use

🎯 Follow these simple steps to get started:


Upload Your JSON File

Upload a correctly formatted JSON file using the plugin. Choose between the array format or object format depending on your use case.

Select the Layer

Highlight the Figma layer containing text objects with placeholders like {{name}} and {{surname}}. Ensure these placeholders are named correctly.

Click “Populate Design”

Let the plugin work its magic! It will duplicate designs or populate data based on your JSON file.


💡 Tip: Double-check placeholder names in your design to match JSON keys for smooth operation.


Why Choose JSON-to-Design?


💡 Smart Automation: Unlike other plugins, this tool simplifies both duplication and data replacement in one intuitive flow.

⏱ Time-Saving Magic: Whether you’re working with a few data points or hundreds, let the plugin handle the heavy lifting while you focus on creativity.
plugins.tagline: The plugin allows you to upload a JSON file and, based on it, populate designs with this data.

plugins.name: Better Title Case
plugins.description:
Not a fan of built-in Figma's title case? Better Title Case got your back!


  1. Select a frame or a group to apply Better Title Case to all text layers inside
  2. Or directly select one or several text layers to apply Better Title Case only to these layers


Safe to use on text layers that have several styles/properties applied to them — plugin will not remove bold or underlined text from your layers.


Current Capitalization Rules:

  1. UPPERCASE words are not processed, so AAPL or MBA will stay as is.
  2. The first and the last word in a sentence are always processed.
  3. There is a custom list of words that shouldn’t be in converted to Title Case: and, as, but, for, if, nor, or, so, yet, a, an, the, as, at, by, for, in, of, off, on, per, to, up, via, vs, v, (vs.) (v.)
  4. Word after em dash and slash processed even if it's a minor word.


If you have any feedback or ideas on improving the plugin — feel free to reach out via email or in comment section 😉.
plugins.tagline: Title Case Plugin We All Deserve

106022.name: Better Title Case
106022.description:

106022.tagline: Title Case Plugin We All Deserve

plugins.name: AutoFrame
plugins.description:
AutoFrame: Connect Airtable Data to Your Figma Designs


Bridge the gap between your data and your designs! Autoframe allows you to seamlessly connect your Airtable bases directly to Figma, automating the creation and synchronization of design elements.


Stop manually copying and pasting data. With Autoframe, you can generate perfectly structured Figma frames populated with real content from your Airtable views, saving you time and reducing errors.


Key Features:

  1. Secure Airtable Connection: Easily connect your Airtable account using a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.
  2. Automated Frame Generation: Select an Airtable Base, Table, and View, and instantly generate Figma frames for each record.
  3. Data-Driven Content: Choose specific Airtable fields to populate text layers within your frames, ensuring your designs reflect your actual data.
  4. Custom Frame Naming: Designate an Airtable field to automatically name your generated frames.
  5. Dynamic Frame Sizing: Optionally add a "Dimensions" field (e.g., 300x500) in your Airtable view to automatically set the width and height of corresponding Figma frames.
  6. Flexible Layout: Control the arrangement of generated frames by specifying the number of columns.
  7. Figma to Airtable: Push text edits or frame name changes made in Figma back to your Airtable base.
  8. Airtable to Figma: Pull the latest data from Airtable to update your existing generated frames without needing to regenerate everything.
  9. Secure Login: Protects access via an Email + One-Time Passcode (OTP) verification system.


How It Works:

  1. Connect: Log in and securely connect your Airtable account.
  2. Select: Choose your Airtable Base, Table, View, and the fields you want to use for frame names and content.
  3. Generate: Click "Generate Frames" to automatically create frames on your Figma canvas populated with your data.
  4. Sync: Use the "Sync Changes to Airtable" or "Sync From Airtable" buttons to keep your designs and data aligned.


Ideal For:

  1. Data-driven design workflows
  2. Managing dynamic content within designs (e.g., user profiles, product cards)
  3. Populating components for design systems
  4. Quickly visualizing data structures from Airtable
  5. Anyone looking to streamline their design process by integrating directly with Airtable.


Get started with AutoFrame today and bring your Airtable data to life in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Autoframe: The Bridge Between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.name: Bureau Works
plugins.description:
With Bureau Works, you can translate and localize your Figma files, along with over 40 other file types, using a platform that leverages LLM for enhanced context in your translations.


You have the option to use just our Figma integration or unlock the full power of our Translation Management System.


Our context-first translation platform allows:

  1. Designers,
  2. Marketers,
  3. Agencies,
  4. Localization managers,
  5. Translators,
  6. Developers


To efficiently translate, contextualize, and scale global experiences, all with the support of enterprise-grade hosting and security.


Trusted by global leaders like Harley-Davidson, Scaled Agile, Automation Anywhere, Uber, and Zendesk.


Why Bureau Works?


  1. Beyond translation memories and glossaries: Optimize SEO with the best terms in multiple languages.
  2. Automate translation workflows: Streamline processes to improve efficiency.
  3. Knowledge management: Centralize your content knowledge for better access.
  4. Advanced permissions: Customize access and roles for different team members.
  5. Quality control: Monitor and ensure translation quality with clear indicators, for all content types—from software and Figma to video and eLearning.


Bureau Works empowers over 20,000 users worldwide to stay ahead of the AI translation game.


How to Set Up


To get started, you'll need a Bureau Works account, please signup here


Follow our Integration tutorial here.


Or send a message to our support team here.


Thank you very much for considering our translation platform. Please, dont hesitate to reach out to us through any of the channels above.
plugins.tagline: Bureau Works Integration for Figma

Blazing-Fast Templates:

Unleash Your Creative Potential:

Imagine the possibilities. More time spent designing, less time spent organising. Happier designers, more efficient projects. That's the Organise Wiz magic.

plugins.name: ContentFlow
plugins.description:
ContentFlow is the ultimate text manager for Figma, designed to keep designs, copy, and teams perfectly aligned. Whether you want to gather and review edits before updating your designs or streamline developer handoff, this plugin simplifies every aspect of text management.


Here’s what you can expect:

  1. ⏳ Postpone Text Updates: Accumulate edits without immediately applying them—batch updates or finalize them as needed.
  2. 🔎 Real-Time Change Detection: Automatically track every tweak in Figma, highlighting modified or removed text layers for quick review.
  3. 👥 Collaborative Updates: Every team member with the plugin sees changes in the file, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.
  4. ⏪ Complete Version History: Access a full log of edits anytime, and revert to previous versions in a click — ideal for instant rollbacks or detailed audits.
  5. 🏷️ Easy Status Labeling: Use four statuses (Progress, Done, Rejected, Dev) to clearly show where each piece of text stands.
  6. 🚀 Developer Mode: Give developers a clean interface showing only finalized content, with one-click copying and preserved formatting.
  7. 🌐 Smart Organization: Search and filter text by status, date, or keywords, with items neatly grouped by frames for instant clarity.
  8. 🎨 Adaptive UI: Switch between light and dark themes, and toggle to a compact layout when you need to save screen space—always keeping things clear and intuitive.


Keep your text workflow efficient, organized, and worry-free. ContentFlow ensures designers, writers, and developers stay perfectly synced with minimal fuss and maximum productivity!
plugins.tagline: A collaborative text manager to track updates, organize content, and streamline dev handoff.

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description:
Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.


Features:

  1. Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.
  2. List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.
  3. Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.
  4. Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.


Why I Created It:

I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.


Use Cases:

  1. Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.
  2. Quickly jump between components and your working frames.
  3. Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

124974.release_notes: Added back and forward buttons, cross-pages history, frame active state and special actions: jumping to selected node in main local component and selecting child node in all instances
124974.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

plugins.name: RNDR: Braze -> FigJam Automation
plugins.description:
🔎 RNDR by For Now Marketing


Automate your Braze-to-FigJam visualization.


RNDR makes it effortless to visualize your Braze Messages directly in FigJam — so your marketing, design, and ops teams can stay aligned without copy-pasting a thing.


⚡ What RNDR can do:

  1. Automatically sync Campaign + Canvas data from Braze into FigJam
  2. Display key details for all messaging channels
  3. View raw HTML + rendered screenshots of all your emails — side by side
  4. Filter by tags you’ve already set in Braze
  5. Visualize everything, all in one place


🆕 New: Email Screenshot Support

No more guessing how your emails look. Instantly see both the raw and fully rendered HTML for every email in your Braze dashboard — embedded right in FigJam.


💬 Get Involved

We’re building fast and would love your feedback!

  1. Join our FNM Product Feedback Slack Community
  2. Or email us at team@fornowmarketing.com
plugins.tagline: Automate your Braze-to-FigJam visualization.

plugins.name: Image Mono Palette
plugins.description: Image Palette is a Figma plugin designed to help you create seamless color schemes. Upload an image, and the plugin extracts its primary color to generate a customizable monochromatic color palette. Perfect for UI/UX designers, branding professionals, and creative projects, this tool simplifies the process of creating harmonious designs by providing tokens and placing the palette directly on your canvas. It's fast, intuitive, and tailored for creativity.
plugins.tagline: Transform images into beautiful monochromatic palettes.

plugins.name: Figma to PowerFX theme converter
plugins.description:
Easily transform your Figma variables into reusable themes for Power Apps with our plugin. Figma to Power FX theme converter is a tool for Power Apps designers and developers who want to streamline their workflow and save time.


Key Features:

  1. Automated Conversion: All the variables in your Figma file are automatically translates into Power FX variables while maintaining the Figma hierarchy.
  2. Collection selection: Choose the collection you want to convert into Power FX.
  3. Color Format: Choose the color format you prefer to use between RGBA and Hexadecimal


We are continuously working on improving the plugin and plan to add new parameters for even more customization in future versions.
plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma variables into themes for use in your Power Apps

135650.name: Figma to PowerFX theme converter
135650.description:
Easily transform your Figma variables into reusable themes for Power Apps with our plugin. Figma to Power FX theme converter is a tool for Power Apps designers and developers who want to streamline their workflow and save time.


Key Features:

  1. Automated Conversion: All the variables in your Figma file are automatically translates into Power FX variables while maintaining the Figma hierarchy.
  2. Collection selection: Choose the collection you want to convert into Power FX.
  3. Color Format: Choose the color format you prefer to use between RGBA and Hexadecimal


We are continuously working on improving the plugin and plan to add new parameters for even more customization in future versions.
135650.release_notes:
Add : 
- Users can now choose the color format to be exported

Change :
- Modes are no longer supported. Only the first mode value is exported.
- Users can choose which tokens to export and curstomize their names.
- Collections whose name begins with an underscore cannot be selected.
135650.tagline: Convert your Figma variables into themes for use in your Power Apps

plugins.name: Page Setup Wizard
plugins.description:
The Page Setup Wizard Plugin is an ultimate tool for streamlined page creation. With just a click, generate pages with preset naming conventions tailored for product design and UX research.


  • 📄 Easily add delivery page names complete with creation or update dates.
  • 🖼 The ability to create a cover page and customize other sections based on individual needs.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly set up your file pages with preset naming conventions to ensure consistency.

plugins.name: Figma to XState
plugins.description:
Please note: the plugin in a work in progress, read here about the roadmap and the features to implement.


I trust XState not only as a powerful development tool, but also for enabling pair programming among engineers and Product stakeholders.


Product teams do not miss much edge cases when they design features through flowcharts. At the same time, I think a Figma prototype to XState machine convert tool can speed up the initial conversion process, allowing later engineering rework the state machine with or without the designers.
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma prototypes to XState’s machine config (🚧 WIP).

39016.name: Misc Toolbox
39016.description: A bunch of useful tools for bulk text editing

plugins.name: コーディングパネル
plugins.description:
「コーディング用の数値がわかりにくい。」

「なんか色が違うと思ったらブレンドモードになってた！」

「字間の設定をよく見逃してしまう・・。」

コーディングをしていてそんな経験はありませんか？


このプラグインでは、レイヤーを選択するとコーディングで必要な数値を、タイポグラフィ、コンテンツ、エフェクトのカテゴリに分けてハイライトします。

さらに、一部コーディングの数値に自動計算したり、カラーコードのHEX値とRGB値の切替えができたり、フレームやグループ化されたレイヤーでもテキストを取得してワンクリックでコピーする機能も追加しました。


多くのデザインデータからコーディングしてきたコーダーが作った、コーダーのためのプラグインです。Figmaでコーディングするなら、ぜひ使ってみてください。


【タイポグラフィ】

テキストレイヤーに反応して、書体、太さ、文字サイズ、行間、字間、文字揃え（上下・左右）、テキスト内容を表示します。


【コンテンツ】

幅、高さ、外見透過、ブレンドモード、塗り、線の情報を表示します。


【エフェクト】

エフェクトの情報を表示します。

インナーシャドウとドロップシャドウは詳細を表示しますが、それ以外のエフェクトはエフェクト名のみ表示します。
plugins.tagline: テキストやコンテンツ、エフェクトなどのコーディングで使用する情報を分かりやすく表示します。騙されたと思って使ってみて。
